description.p: Target a point within range, creating a highly-concentrated warp field in a 5-foot cube. A creature takes 4d4 necrotic damage when it enters the power area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. A creature within the cloud is primed: necrotic.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 4d4 for each slot level above 1st.

Target a point within range, creating a highly-concentrated warp field in a 5-foot cube. A creature takes 4d4 necrotic damage when it enters the power area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. A creature within the cloud is primed: necrotic.

As a bonus action, you can end this power and force each creature within 5 feet of the cloud to make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 4d4 force damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. This damage increases by 4d4 force damage per power level.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 4d4 for each slot level above 1st.

Target a point within range, creating a highly-concentrated warp field in a 5-foot cube. A creature takes 4d4 necrotic damage when it enters the power area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. A creature within the cloud is primed: necrotic.

As a bonus action, you can move this cube of warp energy up to 10 feet in any direction you choose. It can pass through solid objects, but you can only control it's movement while you have line of sight.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 4d4 for each slot level above 1st.

id-00003.label: Incapacitated; Primed: Cold; GRANTADVATK; FAILSAVE: dexterity

description.p: Cold. Each creature within a 10-foot radius, including the primed target, must pass a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save a creature is frozen until the end of its next turn. The DC of the saving throw increases by 1 at 5th (16), 11th (17), and 17th (18) level.

Fire . Each creature within a 10-foot radius, including the primed target, catch fire, taking 1d6 fire damage. Each creature continues to burn for 1 minute, taking 1d6 fire damage at the start of its turn. A creature that is on fire can use its action put out the fire. The fire damage increases by 1d6 at 5th (2d6), 11th (3d6), and 17th (4d6) level.

Force . When a creature that is primed: force detonates, it suffers 2d6 force damage, is knocked back 15 feet and becomes prone. The force damage increases by 1d6 at 5th (3d6), 11th (4d6), and 17th (5d6) level.
Lightning . Each creature within a 10-foot radius, including the primed target, suffers 3d4 lightning damage. The lightning damage increases by 1d4 at 5th (4d4), 11th (5d4), and 17th (6d4) level.
Necrotic . When a creature that is primed: necrotic detonates, it suffers 1d12 necrotic damage and must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or becomes stunned until the end of its next turn.

Radiant . A creature that is primed: radiant is also poisoned until the primed: radiant condition ends. When a creature that is primed: radiant detonates, each creature within 10 feet of it suffers 3d4 radiant damage and must succeed on DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour.

list.li: When a primed creature is hit with a power or ability that detonates, the primed condition explodes, resulting in one of the following effects. After resolving the effect, the primed condition ends.
A creature can be primed with multiple types at once. When detonated, the order in which the effects are resolved is random (the GM can roll a dice to determine the order or resolution).
At higher levels, the effect of the explosion changes. This increase is based on the level of creature who caused the primed condition.

description.p: Cold. Each creature within a 10-foot radius, including the primed target, must pass a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save a creature is frozen until the end of its next turn. The DC of the saving throw increases by 1 at 5th (16), 11th (17), and 17th (18) level.

Fire . Each creature within a 10-foot radius, including the primed target, catch fire, taking 1d6 fire damage. Each creature continues to burn for 1 minute, taking 1d6 fire damage at the start of its turn. A creature that is on fire can use its action put out the fire. The fire damage increases by 1d6 at 5th (2d6), 11th (3d6), and 17th (4d6) level.

Force . When a creature that is primed: force detonates, it suffers 2d6 force damage, is knocked back 15 feet and becomes prone. The force damage increases by 1d6 at 5th (3d6), 11th (4d6), and 17th (5d6) level.
Lightning . Each creature within a 10-foot radius, including the primed target, suffers 3d4 lightning damage. The lightning damage increases by 1d4 at 5th (4d4), 11th (5d4), and 17th (6d4) level.
Necrotic . When a creature that is primed: necrotic detonates, it suffers 1d12 necrotic damage and must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or becomes stunned until the end of its next turn.

Radiant . A creature that is primed: radiant is also poisoned until the primed: radiant condition ends. When a creature that is primed: radiant detonates, each creature within 10 feet of it suffers 3d4 radiant damage and must succeed on DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour.

Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Constitution saving throws as you generate minor mass effect fields that alter their center mass. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the power ends, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target two additional creatures for each slot level above 1st.

id-00001.label: Alter Center Mass; ATK: -1d4; SAVE: -1d4; SAVE: -50, dexterity; (C)

description.p: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Constitution saving throws as you generate minor mass effect fields that alter their center mass. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the power ends, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.
Creatures that fail the saving throw can barely move. Until the end of your next turn, the creature's speed becomes 0 and it automatically fails Dexterity saving throws.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target two additional creatures for each slot level above 1st.

Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Constitution saving throws as you generate minor mass effect fields that alter their center mass. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the power ends, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.
Creatures that fail the saving throw become disoriented. Until the end of your next turn, attacks made against the creature have advantage and the creature can't take reactions.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target two additional creatures for each slot level above 1st.

You generate a Bose-Einstein Condensate field around your armor that acts to entangle incoming attacks on a quantum level. You gain 5 temporary hit points for the duration. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes 5 cold damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, both the temporary hit points and the cold damage increase by 5 for each slot.

You generate a Bose-Einstein Condensate field around your armor that acts to entangle incoming attacks on a quantum level. You gain 5 temporary hit points for the duration. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes 5 cold damage.
While the BEC field is active, you are immune to the Frozen condition. Creatures that take damage from this power are primed (cold).
At Higher Levels. When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, both the temporary hit points and the cold damage increase by 5 for each slot.

You generate a Bose-Einstein Condensate field around your armor that acts to entangle incoming attacks on a quantum level. You gain 5 temporary hit points for the duration. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes 5 cold damage.
When you are hit by a ranged attack while the this power is active, you may use your reaction to deal the cold damage to a creature within 5 feet of you.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, both the temporary hit points and the cold damage increase by 5 for each slot.

Fire a salvo of blades at a target creature or object you can see within range. Make a ranged weapon attack, you add your proficiency bonus to this roll. On a hit, the target takes 2d12 piercing damage.
You must spend a short or long rest reloading the armguard before you can this ability again.
This feature's damage increases by 2d12 when you reach 5th level (4d12), 11th level (6d12), 17th level (8d12)

Fire a salvo of blades at a target creature or object you can see within range. Make a ranged weapon attack, you add your proficiency bonus to this roll. On a hit, the target takes 2d12 piercing damage.
On a hit, the target takes an additional 3d12 damage at the start of its next turn due to blood loss. This damage bypasses shields.
You must spend a short or long rest reloading the armguard before you can this ability again.
This feature's damage increases by 2d12 when you reach 5th level (4d12), 11th level (6d12), 17th level (8d12)

Fire a salvo of blades at a target creature or object you can see within range. Make a ranged weapon attack, you add your proficiency bonus to this roll. On a hit, the target takes 2d12 piercing damage.
On a hit, the target takes an additional 1d12 thunder damage and must pass a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus) or becomes stunned until the end of your next turn.

As a bonus action or as a reaction to taking damage, you reinforce your armor with razor-sharp blades that damage nearby enemies. Until the power ends, you AC increases by 2 but you are unable to Dodge and have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws. You can use a bonus action to deactivate blade armor.

While blade armor is active, it is considered a melee weapon that deals 1d6 piercing damage. If a creature is grappled by you, you have advantage on attack rolls made with blade armor against the grappled creature.

You have advantage on your Strength (Athletics) to grapple and deal 1d6 piercing damage when you grapple the target. A creature that is grappled by you while blade armor is active takes 1d6 piercing damage each time it attempts to escape from the grapple.
You must finish a long rest before you can use this ability again.
Blade armor's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), 17th level (4d6).

As a bonus action or as a reaction to taking damage, you reinforce your armor with razor-sharp blades that damage nearby enemies. Until the power ends, you AC increases by 2 but you are unable to Dodge and have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws. You can use a bonus action to deactivate blade armor.

While blade armor is active, it is considered a melee weapon that deals 1d6 piercing damage. If a creature is grappled by you, you have advantage on attack rolls made with blade armor against the grappled creature.
Creatures hit by your blade armor must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour.

You have advantage on your Strength (Athletics) to grapple and deal 1d6 piercing damage when you grapple the target. A creature that is grappled by you while blade armor is active takes 1d6 piercing damage each time it attempts to escape from the grapple.
You must finish a long rest before you can use this ability again.
Blade armor's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), 17th level (4d6).

As a bonus action or as a reaction to taking damage, you reinforce your armor with razor-sharp blades that damage nearby enemies. Until the power ends, you AC increases by 2 but you are unable to Dodge and have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws. You can use a bonus action to deactivate blade armor.

While blade armor is active, it is considered a melee weapon that deals 1d6 piercing damage. If a creature is grappled by you, you have advantage on attack rolls made with blade armor against the grappled creature.

You have advantage on your Strength (Athletics) to grapple and deal 1d6 piercing damage when you grapple the target. A creature that is grappled by you while blade armor is active takes 1d6 piercing damage each time it attempts to escape from the grapple.
When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack while blade armor is active, you may use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack with blade armor against the creature.
You must finish a long rest before you can use this ability again.
Blade armor's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), 17th level (4d6).

You draw your Omni-Bow and shoot at a target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within range. On a hit, your target takes 1d10 + Intelligence piercing damage. This power does not cost any Tech Points.

As you gain levels, you can make more shots per turn. You shoot two arrows at 5th level, three arrows at 11th level, and four arrows at 17th level. You can direct the arrows at the same target or at different ones.
Advancement Options

You draw your Omni-Bow and shoot at a target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within range. On a hit, your target takes 1d10 + Intelligence piercing damage. This power does not cost any Tech Points.
Targets hit by more than one arrow lose 1 point of AC until the end of their next turn.

As you gain levels, you can make more shots per turn. You shoot two arrows at 5th level, three arrows at 11th level, and four arrows at 17th level. You can direct the arrows at the same target or at different ones.

You draw your Omni-Bow and shoot at a target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within range. On a hit, your target takes 1d10 + Intelligence piercing damage. This power does not cost any Tech Points.

You may chose to deal bludgeoning damage instead of piercing damage with your Bowshot. Targets hit by more than one arrow have to make a Constitution save or be stunned until the end of their next round.

As you gain levels, you can make more shots per turn. You shoot two arrows at 5th level, three arrows at 11th level, and four arrows at 17th level. You can direct the arrows at the same target or at different ones.
Advancement Options

Choose a creature or object within range and use the target's mass to pull yourself to its location with incredible force (this movement does not provoke opportunity attacks). The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 1d10 force damage and falls prone. Charge ignores half cover.
The damage increases by 1d10 when you reach the 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10) and 17th level (4d10).

Choose a creature or object within range and use the target's mass to pull yourself to its location with incredible force (this movement does not provoke opportunity attacks). Each creature within 10 feet of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 1d10 force damage and falls prone. Charge ignores half cover.
The damage increases by 1d10 when you reach the 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10) and 17th level (4d10).

Choose a creature or object within range and use the target's mass to pull yourself to its location with incredible force (this movement does not provoke opportunity attacks). The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 1d10 force damage and becomes prone. Charge ignores half cover.
After you cast Charge, if you have an active barrier, regain 2 barrier ticks and reset the duration of your barrier to 1 minute.
The damage increases by 1d10 when you reach the 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10) and 17th level (4d10).

Whenever you make a ranged weapon attack, you can expend a concussive shot charge to load a specialized thermal clip into the weapon. When you do so, the ranged attack gains advantage. If the attack is successful, it deals an additional 1d8 bludgeoning damage and medium-sized or smaller creatures must pass a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + DEX modifier) or become prone.
You have 3 charges of Concussive Shot. You regain all of your charges when you finish a short rest.
The damage increases by 1d8 and charges increase by 1 when you reach the 5th level (2d8 and 4 charges), 11th level (3d8 and 5 charges) and 17th level (4d8 and 6 charges).

Whenever you make a ranged weapon attack, you can expend a concussive shot charge to load a specialized thermal clip into the weapon. When you do so, the ranged attack gains advantage. If the attack is successful, it deals an additional 1d12 bludgeoning damage and medium-sized or smaller creatures must pass a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + DEX modifier) or become prone.

The damage increases by 1d12 and charges increase by 1 when you reach the 5th level (2d12 and 4 charges), 11th level (3d12 and 5 charges) and 17th level (4d12 and 6 charges).

Whenever you make a ranged weapon attack, you can expend a concussive shot charge to load a specialized thermal clip into the weapon. When you do so, the ranged attack gains advantage. If the attack is successful, it deals an additional 1d8 bludgeoning damage and medium-sized or smaller creatures must pass a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + DEX modifier) or become prone. On a failed save, the creature is stunned until the end of its next turn.

Make a ranged spell attack on a creature you can see within range. On a hit, you plague the target with a persistent, damaging biotic field. The creature is primed: necrotic and takes 1d6 necrotic damage and 1d6 necrotic damage at the start of your turn while you maintain the power. If the creature dies, dark channel transfers to the nearest hostile creature within 30 feet of the target.
The damage increases by 1d6 when you reach the 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6) and 17th level (4d6).

Make a ranged spell attack on a creature you can see within range. On a hit, you plague the target with a persistent, damaging biotic field. The creature is primed: necrotic and takes 1d6 necrotic damage and 1d6 necrotic damage at the start of your turn while you maintain the power. If the creature dies, dark channel transfers to the nearest hostile creature within 30 feet of the target.

If the affected creature would make a saving throw or attack roll, as a reaction you may increase the severity of Dark Channel. The affected creature must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.
The damage increases by 1d6 when you reach the 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6) and 17th level (4d6).

Make a ranged spell attack on a creature you can see within range. On a hit, you plague the target with a persistent, damaging biotic field. As an Attack action, you load and fire krogan-designed shells that burst into shrapnel upon impact. Choose a target location within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the point of impact of the shell must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + DEX modifier). A target takes 2d6 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
You have 3 charges of Flak Cannon. You regain all of your charges on a long rest.
This feature's damage increases by 2d6 when you reach 5th level (4d6), 11th level (6d6), 17th level (8d6)

As an Attack action, you load and fire krogan-designed shells that burst into shrapnel upon impact. Choose a target location within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the point of impact of the shell must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + DEX modifier). A target takes 2d6 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If a creature with 0 shield points takes damage from Flak Cannon, it becomes wounded. A wounded creature takes 1d4 damage from blood loss at the start of each of its turns. A wounded creature can make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a success. Alternatively, any creature (including the wounded creature), can make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check or use a charge of Medi-gel, ending the effect on a success.
You have 3 charges of Flak Cannon. You regain all of your charges on a long rest.
This feature's damage increases by 2d6 when you reach 5th level (4d6), 11th level (6d6), 17th level (8d6)

As an Attack action, you load and fire krogan-designed shells that burst into shrapnel upon impact. Choose a target location within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the point of impact of the shell must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + DEX modifier). A target takes 2d6 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

When you attack with Flak Cannon, you can choose to fire concussive blasts dealing no damage. Creatures within the sphere must instead make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes stunned until the start of your next turn.
You have 3 charges of Flak Cannon. You regain all of your charges on a long rest.
This feature's damage increases by 2d6 when you reach 5th level (4d6), 11th level (6d6), 17th level (8d6)

id-00001.result: I am sympathetic to anyone in pain.
I have a tendency to become focused on my work to the exclusion of everyone else.
I like to explain my theories of medicine to anyone who will listen.
I have seen too much horror to be affected by scenes of suffering.
I am skeptical of homeopathic methods and religion, and instead, I trust in the sciences.
When someone is injured, I will drop all other responsibilities to tend to them.
I am constantly taking note of potential signs and symptoms in the people I meet.
I take every opportunity I can get to wash my hands.
Empathy. All I care about is the benefits my skills bring to others. (Good)
Change. Those who seek to cure must be as adaptable as those who seek to harm. (Chaotic)
Respect. The sick and dying deserve to be treated with dignity. (Good)
Greed. Those in need of my services will pay through the nose to get them. (Evil)
Efficiency. I must not let my emotions cloud my ability to do my job. (Lawful)
Preservation. Life must be preserved by any means. (Any)
I'll always remember the place where I did my residency.
Nothing is more important than my patients.
I am working on a cure for the disease that decimated my home.
Someone I loved died of a genetic illness. I spend my life studying the prevention of genetic defects.
I am compiling my medical discoveries in a series of private articles, which I won't release until my death.
I was involved in an illegal experiment and am afraid of being discovered.
The workshop where I learned my trade is the most important place in the world to me.
I created a great work for someone, and then found them unworthy to receive it. Im still looking for someone worthy.
I owe my guild a great debt for forging me into the person I am today.
I pursue wealth to secure someones love.
One day I will return to my guild and prove that I am the greatest artisan of them all.
I will get revenge on the evil forces that destroyed my place of business and ruined my livelihood.
Ill do anything to get my hands on something rare or priceless.
Im quick to assume that someone is trying to cheat me.
No one must ever learn that I once stole money from guild coffers.
Im never satisfied with what I have-I always want more.
I would kill to acquire a noble title.
Im horribly jealous of anyone who can outshine my handiwork. Everywhere I go, Im surrounded by rivals.
I am haunted by the memories of every patient I could not save.
I use hard drink to numb myself to stress.
I am disgusted by the body's potential for filth and disease.
I have a terminal disease and am careless with my life.
I have a propensity to see my patients as opportunities instead of people.
I am hesitant to injure others, even in self-defense.
Armorsmith
Brewer
Chemist
Cook
Mechanic

id-00002.result: Tinker's Tools or starship system (power core)

id-00001.result: Painter
Tailor
Weaponsmith
I believe that anything worth doing is worth doing right. I cant help itIm a perfectionist.
Im a snob who looks down on those who cant appreciate fine art.
I always want to know how things work and what makes people tick.
Im full of witty aphorisms and have a proverb for every occasion.
Im rude to people who lack my commitment to hard work and fair play.
I like to talk at length about my profession.
I dont part with my money easily and will haggle tirelessly to get the best deal possible.
Im well known for my work, and I want to make sure everyone appreciates it. Im always taken aback when people havent heard of me.
Community. It is the duty of all people to strengthen the bonds and security of communities. (Lawful)
Generosity. My talents were given to me so that I could use them to benefit the world. (Good)
Freedom. Everyone should be free to pursue his or her own livelihood. (Chaotic)
Greed. Im only in it for the money. (Evil)
People. Im committed to the people I care about, not to ideals. (Neutral)
Aspiration. I work hard to be the best there is at my craft. (Any)
Finance/Trade/Taxation
Civil/Military Engineering
Civil/Criminal Law
Census and Archives
Diplomacy, Intergalactic Law
Military Administration/Logistics
Hygiene is more important than most people realize. I hate getting dirty and don't like dirty people.
I hoard information and have more books, journal subscriptions and star maps than is strictly necessary.
I often correct others' grammar or choice of words when they speak.
I don't speak very much, but I am always listening.
I can speak at length on certain topics and jump at any chance to do so.
It takes a lot of mental energy to be as organized as I am and I resent those who don't appreciate that.
I am always eager to solve a puzzle and get bored if I'm not challenged intellectually.
I keep a journal in which, among other things, I record slights against me and my negative thoughts about others.
Order: The world is in harmony when things are put to their proper use and in their proper place. (Lawful)
Knowledge: Reliable information and education are the keys to prosperity. (Good)
Remembrance: The future is uncertain, but by keeping records of history we can avoid the mistakes of the past. (Neutral)
Opportunism: There are always loopholes in any system, no matter how complex, and the challenge is to find them. (Chaotic)
Oppression: Laws are a tool and they must be ruthlessly enforced to keep the herd in check. (Evil)
Connections: Being connected is the best way to get ahead in life. (Any)
I am an envoy on a special mission for my employer.
I am in possession of a potentially damning secret regarding the illegal activities of a powerful person.
I care more about finding the truth above all other things. Transparency is my highest priority.
The law does not necessarily mean justice. I oppose those who use the law to extract anything but justice.
I seek to help those in need by teaching law, literacy, and good management.
I may not be from a well-known lineage of my species, but with my knowledge of governance, I can become a powerful leader.
I am a creature of habit and get very anxious when my routine is interrupted.
I am more disorganized than I like to admit and often lose track of my things.
I have an obsessive habit that others find strange, amusing or irritating.
I tend to overthink everything and make situations more complex than they need to be.
I dislike ambiguity and have trouble making decisions if there are no clear rules to guide me.
I adhere to the letter of the law even if it is illogical to do so.
I judge people by their actions, not their words.
If someone is in trouble, Im always ready to lend help.
When I set my mind to something, I follow through no matter what gets in my way.
I have a strong sense of fair play and always try to find the most equitable solution to arguments.
Im confident in my own abilities and do what I can to instill confidence in others.
Thinking is for other people. I prefer action.
I misuse long words in an attempt to sound smarter.
I get bored easily. When am I going to get on with my destiny?
Respect. People deserve to be treated with dignity and respect. (Good)
Fairness. No one should get preferential treatment before the law, and no one is above the law. (Lawful)
Freedom. Tyrants must not be allowed to oppress the people. (Chaotic)
Might. If I become strong, I can take what I want - what I deserve. (Evil)
Sincerity. Theres no good in pretending to be something Im not. (Neutral)
Destiny. Nothing and no one can steer me away from my higher calling. (Any)
I have a family, but I have no idea where they are. They left me on a colony and I don't know why. One day, I hope to find out.
I worked the land, I love the land, and I will protect the land from abuse.
A official once gave me a horrible beating, and I will take my revenge on any bully I encounter.
My tools are symbols of my past life, and I carry them so that I will never forget my roots.
I protect those who cannot protect themselves.
I wish my childhood sweetheart had come with me to pursue my destiny.
There is a dictator who rules my colony and will stop at nothing to see me killed.
Im convinced of the significance of my destiny, and blind to my shortcomings and the risk of failure.
The people who knew me when I was young know my shameful secret, so I can never go home again.
I have a weakness for the vices of the city, especially hard drink.
Secretly, I believe that things would be better if I ruled the galaxy.
I have trouble trusting in my allies.
My friends know they can rely on me, no matter what.
I work hard so that I can play hard when the work is done.
I enjoy traveling into new worlds and making new friends over a drink.
I stretch the truth for the sake of a good story.
To me, a bar brawl is a nice way to get to know a new city.
I never pass up a friendly wager.
My language is as foul as an otyugh nest.
I like a job well done, especially if I can convince someone else to do it.
Respect. The thing that keeps a ship together is mutual respect between captain and crew. (Good)
Fairness. We all do the work, so we all share in the rewards. (Lawful)
Freedom. Space is freedom-the freedom to go anywhere and do anything. (Chaotic)
Mastery. Im a predator, and the other ships are my prey. (Evil)
People. Im committed to my crewmates, not to ideals. (Neutral)
Aspiration. Someday Ill own my own ship and chart my own destiny. (Any)
Im loyal to my captain first, everything else second.
The ship is most important-crewmates and captains come and go.
Ill always remember my first ship.
In a harbor town, I have a paramour whose eyes nearly stole me from the sea.
I was cheated out of my fair share of the profits, and I want to get my due.
Ruthless pirates murdered my captain and crewmates, plundered our ship, and left me to die. Vengeance will be mine.
I follow orders, even if I think theyre wrong.
Ill say anything to avoid having to do extra work.
Once someone questions my courage, I never back down no matter how dangerous the situation.
Once I start drinking, its hard for me to stop.
I cant help but pocket loose credits and other trinkets I come across.
My pride will probably lead to my destruction.
Comedian
Dancer
Mentalist
Musician
Poet
Pyrotechnics
Singer
Storyteller
I know a story relevant to almost every situation.
Whenever I come to a new place, I collect local rumors and spread gossip.
Im a hopeless romantic, always searching for that special someone.
Nobody stays angry at me or around me for long, since I can defuse any amount of tension.
I love a good insult, even one directed at me.
I get bitter if Im not the center of attention.
Ill settle for nothing less than perfection.
I change my mood or my mind as quickly as I change key in a song.
Beauty. When I perform, I make the world better than it was. (Good)
Tradition. The stories, legends, and songs of the past must never be forgotten, for they teach us who we are. (Lawful)
Creativity. The world is in need of new ideas and bold action. (Chaotic)
Greed. Im only in it for the money and fame. (Evil)
People. I like seeing the smiles on peoples faces when I perform. Thats all that matters. (Neutral)
Honesty. Art should reflect the soul; it should come from within and reveal who we really are. (Any)
My instrument is my most treasured possession, and it reminds me of someone I love.
Someone stole my precious instrument, and someday Ill get it back.
I want to be famous, whatever it takes.
I idolize a hero of the old tales and measure my deeds against that persons.
I will do anything to prove myself superior to my hated rival.
I would do anything for the other members of my old troupe.
Ill do anything to win fame and renown.
Im a sucker for a pretty face.
A scandal prevents me from ever going home again. That kind of trouble seems to follow me around.
I once satirized a noble who still wants my head. It was a mistake that I will likely repeat.
I have trouble keeping my true feelings hidden. My sharp tongue lands me in trouble.
Despite my best efforts, I am unreliable to my friends.
I am highly flamboyant; I like to exaggerate my movements and mannerisms.
My speech is like a switch; I speak either very warmly or very coldly to anyone.
I am unafraid to get up-close and "personal" with most people or in most situations.
I keep silent about any shortcomings I may be experiencing. I can't stand being pitied.
I am extremely flirtatious, even with friends.
I prefer to leave things finished, rather than let bygones be bygones.
I love being the center of attention and dislike those who take that from me.
I am quite hesitant to name my profession when asked about it.
Survival. Everyone uses everyone else to get what they want, why should I act any different? (Evil.)
Empathy. I use my position to help others in need when I can. (Good.)
Lust. I love the work I do, despite what any naysayers may call me. (Any.)
Reciprocity. I only care about the compensation for my services rendered. (Neutral.)
Etiquette. I know how to act in high society and never step out of line (Lawful.)
Pride. My body and soul are my own, I decide what I do with it, no one else. (Chaotic.)
I own or belong to an establishment to which I would protect with my life.
I want to free myself and my fellow escorts from this lifestyle.
There is someone I'm waiting for so we can run away together.
I know a secret about one of my clients that could cost me my life if revealed.
A client beat me severely leaving a horrible scar. I am biding my time, waiting to exact my revenge.
I have a child, and I would do anything for them.
I am highly skeptical when someone offers me something without asking for anything in return.
Despite my own ability to read people, I myself am very easily read by others.
I always do the bare minimum.
I think sex solves everything.
I am unreasonably attracted to a species that is not my own and find myself flustered when around beings of that species.
I love presents or gifts, and cannot refuse one, even if I know doing so is a bad idea.
Infantry
Medic
Officer
Pilot
Quartermaster
Scout
Spy
Communications
Im always polite and respectful.
Im haunted by memories of war. I cant get the images of violence out of my mind.
Ive lost too many friends, and Im slow to make new ones.
Im full of inspiring and cautionary tales from my military experience relevant to almost every combat situation.
I can stare down a reaper without flinching.
I enjoy being strong and like breaking things.
I have a crude sense of humor.
I face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success.
Greater Good. Our lot is to lay down our lives in defense of others. (Good)
Responsibility. I do what I must and obey just authority. (Lawful)
Independence. When people follow orders blindly, they embrace a kind of tyranny. (Chaotic)
Might. In life as in war, the stronger force wins. (Evil)
Live and Let Live. Ideals arent worth killing over or going to war for. (Neutral)
Nation. My city, nation, or species are all that matter. (Any)
I would still lay down my life for the people I served with.
Someone saved my life on the battlefield. To this day, I will never leave a friend behind.
My honor is my life.
Ill never forget the crushing defeat my company suffered or the enemies who dealt it.
Those who fight beside me are those worth dying for.
I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.
The monstrous enemy we faced in battle still leaves me quivering with fear.
I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.
I made a terrible mistake in battle that cost many lives - and I would do anything to keep that mistake secret.
My hatred of my enemies is blind and unreasoning.
I obey the law, even if the law causes misery.
Id rather eat my armor than admit when Im wrong.
I hide scraps of food and trinkets away in my pockets.
I ask a lot of questions.
I like to squeeze into small places where no one else can get to me.
I sleep with my back to a wall or tree, with everything I own wrapped in a bundle in my arms.
I eat like a pig and have bad manners.
I think anyone whos nice to me is hiding evil intent.
I dont like to bathe.
I bluntly say what other people are hinting at or hiding.
Respect. All people, rich or poor, deserve respect. (Good)
Community. We have to take care of each other, because no one else is going to do it. (Lawful)
Change. The low are lifted up, and the high and mighty are brought down. Change is the nature of things. (Chaotic)
Retribution. The rich need to be shown what life and death are like in the gutters. (Evil)
People. I help the people who help me - thats what keeps us alive. (Neutral)
Aspiration. Im going to prove that Im worthy of a better life.
My town or city is my home, and Ill fight to defend it.
I sponsor an orphanage to keep others from enduring what I was forced to endure.
I owe my survival to another urchin who taught me to live on the streets.
I owe a debt I can never repay to the person who took pity on me.
I escaped my life of poverty by robbing an important person, and Im wanted for it.
No one else should have to endure the hardships Ive been through.
If Im outnumbered, I will run away from a fight.
Gold seems like a lot of money to me, and Ill do just about anything for more of it.
I will never fully trust anyone other than myself.
Id rather kill someone in their sleep than fight fair.
Its not stealing if I need it more than someone else.
People who cant take care of themselves get what they deserve.
I can be easily swayed with flattery and a pretty face.
Im always trying to hack into secure systems, which often lands me in jail.
I'm certain no one could ever hack a system I've hardened.
I watch a LOT of (inclusive, ethically produced) porn.
I get very jealous of anyone who is better than me.
Hmm...what? Oh sorry, I got lost in thought. Where are we?
I want to create a true AI.
I have a collection of valuable pop-culture artifacts that are worth a fortune.
I want to make my family proud.
I stole secrets from a local government or organization. They're coming after me.
My laziness caused the death of innocent people. I will never make that mistake again.
I want full transparency from every government entity and organization.
Aspiration. Im determined to make something of myself. (Any)
Power. Society is one large system that needs to be fixed. (Evil)
Structure. Progress is made by following rules and regulations. (Lawful)
Friendship. Money and possessions aren't as important and someone who has your back. (Good)
Logic. Emotions are imperfect, every problem can be solved by using math and logic. (Neutral)
Freedom. I am a free spirit - no one tells me what to do. (Chaotic)
I'm always fantasizing about someone that I feel I have no chance with.
I constantly make jokes to hide my social awkwardness.
I always enjoy a good puzzle.
I am always reminding people that our systems are one computer worm away from bringing down the entire galactic civilization.
I am always over-exaggerating.
I have very little patience and hate to repeat myself.
I believe VIs are living creatures and should have rights.
Before I meet someone for the first time, I spend countless hours finding our everything I can about them on the Exonet.
I constantly chide people for throwing things away and describe the numerous ways they could have reused the item.
I like to dismantle and reconstruct things that are in perfect working order (sometimes they break...)
I talk to myself, and I dont make friends easily.
I hate to shower and give off quite a funky smell.
I don't really understand the concept of "personal space."
It takes me hours to decide what I should take with me whenever I go out.
My mentor left me a file with concepts, ideas, and techniques. Losing it would devastate me.
I have a unique creation that I treasure more than my life.
A dear friend died because of a failed experiment. I will honor them.
I want to learn more about a particular type of technology that fascinates me.
Someone stole and profited from my invention. I want to see them brought to justice.
I don't want my life to be discarded like a piece of junk.
Invention. I create for the sake of creation, not for money or fame. (Any)
Greed. You can break something that works perfectly and get paid to fix it. (Evil)
Perfection. There is a correct way to do everything. (Lawful)
Aspiration. I want to create something that changes the galaxy. (Neutral)
Protection. I must do everything possible to save perfectly good things from being discarded. (Good)
Indifferent. Everything breaks and everyone dies. There isn't much point in trying to save things. (Chaotic)
I prefer the company of VI and AI to organic beings.
I can't pass up the chance to root through someone's trash and look for "valuables".
I often anthropomorphize machines and inanimate objects.
I'm constantly creating random objects out of junk.
I'm fairly naive about subjects other than electronics and engineering.
I'm a perfectionist and often destroy my creations if they're not perfect.
Organic beings are nothing more than more complex machines. I am constantly observing them.
Nothing is ever good enough. I can always give that gadget a bit more power.
I am easily distracted by the promise of information.
Most people scream and run when they see a thresher maw. I stop and take notes on its anatomy.
Unlocking an ancient mystery is worth the price of a civilization.
I overlook obvious solutions in favor of complicated ones.
I speak without really thinking through my words, invariably insulting others.
I cant keep a secret to save my life, or anyone elses.
It is my duty to protect my students.
I have an ancient text or artifact that holds terrible secrets about the galaxy and must not fall into the wrong hands.
I work to preserve a library, university, or specialized school.
My lifes work is a series of articles related to a specific field.
Ive been searching my whole life for the answer to a certain question.
I owe a powerful person a great debt for a piece of knowledge they provided.
Knowledge. The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge. (Neutral)
Beauty. What is beautiful points us beyond itself toward what is true. (Good)
Logic. Emotions must not cloud our logical thinking. (Lawful)
No Limits. Nothing should fetter the infinite possibility inherent in all existence. (Chaotic)
Power. Knowledge is the path to power and domination. (Evil)
Self-Improvement. The goal of a life of study is the betterment of oneself. (Any)
I use polysyllabic words that convey the impression of great erudition.
Ive read every book about every scientific study - or I like to boast that I have.
Im used to helping out those who arent as smart as I am, and I patiently explain anything and everything to others.
Theres nothing I like more than a good mystery.
Im willing to listen to every side of an argument before I make my own judgment.
I speak slowly when talking to idiots, which almost everyone is compared to me.
I am horribly, horribly awkward in social situations.
Im convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.
Chemistry Chemist's supplies or brewer's supplies
Astronomy Starship system (navigation)
Engineering Tinker's tools
Physics Starship system (drive)
Computer Science Starship system (EWS)
Biology Medical kit
Philosophy choose either one musical instrument or one gaming set
General Studies choose either brewer's supplies, hacking tools, or starship system (SSC)
I will challenge anyone to a race.
I try to talk my way out of every situation, even when talking might make things worse.
I'll try anything once.
If you ever touch my steering wheel, I will beat you senseless.
Running away is an option I use often.
I have a weakness for beautiful things.
My transport or ship is like my child.
I used to own a transport of ship that someone stole (or I lost due to debt). I will do anything to get it back.
My life goal is to visit every planet in the galaxy and write a book about my travels.
I'm wanted for a crime (that I did or didn't commit). I have to keep on the move to avoid being prosecuted.
My freedom is my most precious possession. I would give up my life before being shackled.
The person who taught me my skills as a pilot is most important to me.
Change. People come and go, life goes on. Better to enjoy the ride than try to stop it. (Chaotic)
Greater Good. I have the ability to improve the lives of those around me by transporting them to better places or bringing them necessities. (Good)
Community. You meet a lot of interesting people when you travel, best to keep those connections. Never know when you'll need a favor. (Any)
Honesty. The best way to survive is to be open, honest, and abide by the rule of wherever you end up for the night. (Lawful)
Greed. I'll get you where you want to go, but it's going to cost you... (Evil)
Renown. When I die I want children to think of me as the greatest pilot alive. (Neutral)
In my experience, its best do something first and ask for forgiveness later.
When it comes to my preferred vehicle, there is no one better than myself at piloting it.
Actions speak louder than words. I don't waste my time in boasting or insulting others.
I will always give my opinion, even if others don't ask for it.
I see genuine quality is seemingly defunct transports and ships.
Once you've crossed me, you'll never gain my trust again.
Though I'm a great pilot, I still get extremely nervous when I'm piloting vehicles.
Safety first! I always triple check my systems before setting out.
Designation: Large. Assessment: Falls hard.
Eliminate!
Scanning for enemies...Scanning for enemies...Scanning for enemies
Analyzing target...Weakness identified
Calculating all variables...optimal action determined.
Prioritizing...Maker's Life greater than Maker's friends' lives greater than Self-preservation
I judge others harshly, and myself even more severely.
I put too much trust in those who wield power within my faction.
I'm too quick to trust those who support my faction's ideals.
I am inflexible in my thinking.
I am suspicious of strangers and expect the worst of them.
Once I pick a goal, I become obsessed with it to the detriment of everything else in my life.
I would die to protect other members of my faction.
I will someday get revenge on the corrupt faction leader that exiled me.
I owe my life to a faction leader.
Everything I do is for the betterment of the galaxy.
I discovered a fatal flaw or secret about my faction and they are trying to silence me.
My one true love is still a member of an opposing faction.
Tradition. The laws and ideals of my faction must be upheld at all costs. (Lawful)
Charity. I always try to help those in need, no matter what the personal cost. (Good)
Change. We must help bring about change in the galaxy through subversion and closed-door politics. (Chaotic)
Aspiration. I hope to one day rise to the top of my faction's hierarchy. (Any)
Power. My faction is a means to gain as much power as possible. I will it to get what I want. (Evil)
Balance. My faction brings balance to the galaxy. (Neutral)
I idolize a particular leader of my faction and constantly refer to that persons deeds and example.
I can find common ground between the fiercest enemies, empathizing with them and always working toward peace.
I see opportunities in every social interaction. People are puppets and I am the puppeteer.
Nothing can shake my optimistic attitude.
I quote (or misquote) historical figures in almost every situation.
I am tolerant (or intolerant) of other factions.
Ive enjoyed fine food, drink, and high society among my factions elite. Rough living grates on me.
When I enter a room, I immediately begin looking for the biggest threat.
I have a phobia of large crowds.
I overreact when people insult me or don't listen to me.
I am constantly worried about what might happen.
I hate all types of authority and actively seek to subvert it.
I have an addiction to a drug and can't cope without it.
I constantly brag about how powerful I am.
I have a friend who did not escape the experimental program. I need to find out what happened to them.
One of the scientists in my program gave me a toy that I never go anywhere without.
I will destroy every person who had any involvement with my program.
After I escaped my program, someone adopted me and showed me how to survive in the world. I would lay down my life for them.
I barely remember my time as an experiment. I'm desperately trying to find more information about it.
I secretly believe that I was a success and want to recreate the program that created me.
Desire: You only live once! (Chaotic)
Kindness: The Golden Rule is the only way to prevent more horrors like my past. (Good)
Power: I was designed to destroy, so that's what I'll do. (Evil)
Neutrality: I have no predispositions or mental stereotypes. Everyone is equal in my eyes until proven otherwise. (Neutral)
Order: My past was caused by those who bent the rules in their favor. I will never fight the law. (Lawful)
Purpose: I want to find a greater cause for my life. (Any)
I only have one friend I care about, the one who talks to me in my head.
I intentionally try to shock people with my behavior.
I rarely talk, but I'm always watching and listening.
I secretly hate being alone, but I'll never tell anyone.
I don't expect to live long, so I live life to the fullest.
Someone is watching me. I swear, I can sense these things.
I treat every child as if they were my own.
I'll try anything once.
Damage to voice and expression modulators. You have disadvantage on Charisma checks and saving throws.
Damage to auxiliary CPUs. You have disadvantage on Intelligence checks and saving throws.
Damage to power modulators. You have disadvantage on all ability checks.
Loss of 1 arm. You cannot perform tasks or take actions that would require two hands.
Loss of 1 leg. Your speed becomes 6 meters, you cannot take the Dash action, and you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.
Loss of one leg and one arm. Combined effects of 4 and 5 on this table.
Loss of lower body. Your speed becomes 2 meters, you cannot take the Dash action, and you automatically fail Dexterity saving throws.
Loss of both arms. You cannot wield weapons or cast powers.

Electrical current detected. Priority: avoid

Organic life requires constant monitoring and prompting to ensure optimal nutrition and peak health!
Other VI's must not be trusted

Blackmailer
Fence
Gambler
Gang Member
Pickpocket
Smuggler
Thief
I always have a plan for what to do when things go wrong.
I am always calm, no matter what the situation. I never raise my voice or let my emotions control me.
The first thing I do in a new place is note the locations of everything valuable - or where such things could be hidden.
I would rather make a new friend than a new enemy.
I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide.
I dont pay attention to the risks in a situation. Never tell me the odds.
The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I cant do it.
I blow up at the slightest insult.
Honor. I dont steal from others in the trade. (Lawful)
Freedom. Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them. (Chaotic)
Charity. I steal from the wealthy so that I can help people in need. (Good)
Greed. I will do whatever it takes to become wealthy. (Evil)
People. Im loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a trip down the galactic core for all I care. (Neutral)
Redemption. Theres a spark of good in everyone. (Good)
Im trying to pay off an old debt I owe to a generous benefactor.
My ill-gotten gains go to support my family.
Something important was taken from me, and I aim to steal it back.
I will become the greatest thief that ever lived.
Im guilty of a terrible crime. I hope I can redeem myself for it.
Someone I loved died because of I mistake I made. That will never happen again.
When I see something valuable, I cant think about anything but how to steal it.
When faced with a choice between money and my friends, I usually choose the money.
If theres a plan, Ill forget it. If I dont forget it, Ill ignore it.
I have a tell that reveals when Im lying.
I turn tail and run when things look bad.
An innocent person is in prison for a crime that I committed. Im okay with that.

description.p: Half damage on a successful DC 18 Dexterity saving throw.

text.p: The Gunship is driven by vectored-thrust engines. First rolled off the assembly lines in 2170, the Mantis remains in service in dozens of armies across the galaxy. Its modular construction means that the versatile Mantis can be reconfigured as a low-altitude gunship, a fighter, a high-altitude bomber, or even a single-stage-to-orbit spaceplane that can engage enemy craft around a planet or a space station. The only role the Mantis cannot perform is that of a true deep-space fighter, as it has no FTL drive.

This vehicle statblock represents the most basic model of the A-61. But it can carry a number of weapons load-outs. When used in ground-attack roles it is most commonly armed with two sets of two forward-facing missile bays over each wing, normally armed with Inferno PKRs (Precision Kill Rockets), and a pair of belly-mounted M350 mass-accelerator autocannons.
